docs.snippet: Mr. Trump has long preferred the advice of family over political operatives, and Mr. Kushner is seen as a de facto campaign manager....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump has long preferred the advice of family over political operatives, and Mr. Kushner is seen as a de facto campaign manager.
docs.abstract: Donald J Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner has become his de facto campaign manager, vetting potential running mates and helping write speeches; many find it odd pairing, given fact Kushner is Orthodox Jew and grandson of Holocaust survivors, yet is now at center of campaign embraced by white nationalists and anti-Semites.

headline.main: Quiet Fixer in Donald Trump’s Campaign: His Son-in-Law, Jared Kushner
headline.print_headline: A Son-in-Law Wields Power in Trump’s Bid

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and JONATHAN MAHLER

docs.snippet: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan on Tuesday sharply criticized Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's Twitter post depicting Democratic rival Hillary Clinton against a backdrop of cash and a Star of David, saying anti-Semi...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan on Tuesday sharply criticized Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's Twitter post depicting Democratic rival Hillary Clinton against a backdrop of cash and a Star of David, saying anti-Semitic images have "no place in a presidential campaign."

docs.snippet: As Republicans head to Cleveland to nominate Mr. Trump in two weeks, a vortex of headwinds are rising against him in the crucial battleground state....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Republicans head to Cleveland to nominate Mr. Trump in two weeks, a vortex of headwinds are rising against him in the crucial battleground state.
docs.abstract: Donald J Trump is facing headwinds in Ohio, critical state that every Republican who has won White House has carried; as GOP prepares for convention in Cleveland, polls show most Republicans prefer different nominee, and grass-roots activists for Trump in state could be scarce.

headline.main: Donald Trump Finds Himself Playing Catch-Up in All-Important Ohio
headline.print_headline: Trump Finds Himself Playing Catch-Up in Ohio, a Bellwether State for the G.O.P.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama vigorously vouched for Hillary Clinton's trustworthiness and dedication Tuesday, making his first outing on the campaign stump for his former secretary of state just hours after his FBI director blasted her handling of classified material.

docs.snippet: Every election brings a wave of political books, but this year is already exceptional in terms of how many have Donald Trump as the central character....
docs.lead_paragraph: Every election brings a wave of political books, but this year is already exceptional in terms of how many have Donald Trump as the central character.
docs.abstract: Publishers are churning out books about presumptive Republican presidential candidate Donald J Trump at lightning-fast speed in order to capitalize on his surprising political rise and larger-than-life personality.

headline.main: Trump’s Rise Inspires a Rush to Publish (and Exhume) Books About Him
headline.print_headline: A Rush  for Books on Trump

docs.snippet: The FBI lifted a major legal threat to Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign Tuesday, recommending no criminal charges for her handling of highly classified material in a private email account. But Director James Comey's scathing criticism of he...
docs.lead_paragraph: The FBI lifted a major legal threat to Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign Tuesday, recommending no criminal charges for her handling of highly classified material in a private email account. But Director James Comey's scathing criticism of her "extremely careless" behavior revitalized Republican attacks and guaranteed the issue will continue to dog her.

headline.main: No Charges for Clinton, FBI Says _ Despite Biting Criticism
headline.print_headline: No Charges for Clinton, FBI Says _ Despite Biting Criticism
